edu.cnm.deepdive.project_titan.service

Class BaseFluentAsyncTask<Params,Progress,Intermediate,Result>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.os.AsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
      • edu.cnm.deepdive.project_titan.service.BaseFluentAsyncTask<Params,Progress,Intermediate,Result>
  • Type Parameters:
    Params - type of input parameters used by the asynchronous task (consumed by perform(Object[])), or Void if no inputs will be used.
    Progress - type of individual values provided by the asynchronous task for progress updates (consumed by onProgressUpdate(Object[])), or (usually) Void if no progress updates will be made.
    Intermediate - type of result data produced by the basic background processing of the asynchronous task (returned by perform(Object[]) and consumed by BaseFluentAsyncTask.Transformer.transform(Object), or (usually) Void if the background processing is not intended to return a result.
    Result - type of result data produced by the transform processing of the asynchronous task (returned by BaseFluentAsyncTask.Transformer.transform(Object) and consumed by onPostExecute(Object) and onCancelled(Object), or (usually) Void if the background processing is not intended to return a result.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProjectTitanService.GetAchievementTask

    public class BaseFluentAsyncTask<Params,Progress,Intermediate,Result>
extends AsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
    Declares methods, nested interfaces, and a nested exception class, intended to encourage a more fluent, functional, and service-oriented style of extending AsyncTask.

    One aim of this approach is to encourage implementation of AsyncTask subclasses that are loosely coupled with consumer logic, and easily reused. For example, if multiple activities or fragments need to perform a similar database operation, but with slight differences in UI updates and other post-processing logic, the general operation can be implemented in a single subclass of BaseFluentAsyncTask, with variations specified via lambdas in fluent invocations of setTransformer(Transformer), setProgressListener(ProgressListener), and (possibly) setFailureListener(ResultListener).

    For a simple AsyncTask implementation, with a single point of consumption, an instance of this class can be created and used, specifying all key lifecycle logic via individual lambdas or anonymous classes.

    Note that this class overrides AsyncTask.doInBackground(Object[]), splitting background processing into 2 phases: performance and transformation (the latter need not transform the values returned from the former; instead, it might simply be additional background processing that differs between the different consumers). The first phase produces an intermediate value; the second takes the intermediate value, performs some additional processing, and produces a result. Simple extensions or uses of BaseFluentAsyncTask will generally only need to implement the performance phase—either by overriding perform(Params...), or by specifying a lambda or instance of an anonymous class in an invocation of setPerformer(Performer).

    Important: If the Intermediate and Result types specified for an instance of this class (or a subclass) are different, then setTransformer(Transformer) must be invoked to configure a mapping object between values of those 2 types; otherwise, a ClassCastException is likely to be thrown.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer<Params,Intermediate>
      Declares a BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer.perform(Object[]) method that can be implemented to perform basic background processing in an instance of BaseFluentAsyncTask.
      static interface  BaseFluentAsyncTask.ProgressListener<Progress>
      Declares an BaseFluentAsyncTask.ProgressListener.update(Object[]) method that can be implemented to provide UI updates (for example) while a background task is ongoing.
      static interface  BaseFluentAsyncTask.ResultListener<Result>
      Declares a BaseFluentAsyncTask.ResultListener.handle(Object) method that can be implemented to perform additional processing on the UI thread following completion of background processing.
      static class  BaseFluentAsyncTask.TaskException
      Thrown by background task methods (perform(Object[]), BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer.perform(Object[]), and BaseFluentAsyncTask.Transformer.transform(Object)) to indicate unsuccessful (but not necessarily problematic) completion of background processing.
      static interface  BaseFluentAsyncTask.Transformer<Intermediate,Result>
      Declares a BaseFluentAsyncTask.Transformer.transform(Object) method that can be implemented to perform additional background processing following successful completion of the perform(Object[]) method.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class android.os.AsyncTask

        AsyncTask.Status

    • Method Detail

      • perform

        @Nullable
protected Intermediate perform(Params... params)
                                   throws BaseFluentAsyncTask.TaskException
        Executes basic processing of asynchronous task. This method will always be invoked on a background thread; no UI modifications should be attempted from this method, but should instead be performed in the lambdas/interface implementations specified to setProgressListener(ProgressListener), setSuccessListener(ResultListener), and setFailureListener(ResultListener).
        Parameters:
        params - input arguments to background processing.
        Returns:
        intermediate results.
        Throws:
        BaseFluentAsyncTask.TaskException - to indicate that AsyncTask.cancel(boolean) should be invoked, resulting in the eventual invocation of onCancelled(Object), and consequently, the lambda or BaseFluentAsyncTask.ResultListener implementation specified to setFailureListener(ResultListener).

      • doInBackground

        @Nullable
protected Result doInBackground(Params... params)
        Implements the abstract AsyncTask.doInBackground(Object[]) to divide background processing into 2 components: performance and transformation. If the performance phase (implemented in perform(Object[]) throws a BaseFluentAsyncTask.TaskException, the transformation phase (specified in setTransformer(Transformer)) will not be executed. Any value (including null returned by perform(Object[]) will be passed in the invocation to BaseFluentAsyncTask.Transformer.transform(Object).

        As a rule, subclasses of BaseFluentAsyncTask should not override this method, but should instead override perform(Object[]), or provide a lambda or BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer implementation to setPerformer(Performer).

        Specified by:
        doInBackground in class AsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
        Parameters:
        params - input arguments to background processing.
        Returns:
        background processing results.

      • onProgressUpdate

        protected void onProgressUpdate(Progress... values)
        Invokes BaseFluentAsyncTask.ProgressListener.update(Object[]), presumably to update the UI to display the progress/status of the background processing. Rather than overriding this method, the setProgressListener(ProgressListener) method should be invoked on instances of this class or a subclass.
        Overrides:
        onProgressUpdate in class AsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
        Parameters:
        values - progress

      • onPostExecute

        protected void onPostExecute(@Nullable
                             Result result)
        Invokes BaseFluentAsyncTask.ResultListener.handle(Object) to perform any UI thread-based post-processing after successful completion of background processing. Rather than overriding this method, the setSuccessListener(ResultListener) method should generally be invoked on instances of this class or a subclass.
        Overrides:
        onPostExecute in class AsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
        Parameters:
        result - background processing results.

        protected void onCancelled(@Nullable
                           Result result)

Rather than overriding this method, the setFailureListener(ResultListener) method should generally be invoked on instances of this class or a subclass.
        Overrides:

      • setPerformer

        public BaseFluentAsyncTask<Params,Progress,Intermediate,Result> setPerformer(BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer<Params,Intermediate> performer)
        Specifies the BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer implementation instance (usually a lambda) to be used for basic background processing. Consumer code may invoke this method directly on an instance of this class, or override perform(Object[]) in a subclass. In either case, BaseFluentAsyncTask.TaskException may be thrown to signal unsuccessful completion (aka failure) of the background processing.
        Parameters:
        performer - BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer callback object or lambda.
        Returns:
        this instance (for fluent-style method chaining).
